# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function called `wrap_string` that wraps the text based on the given `text_width`:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    wrapped_lines = []
    
    current_line_words = []
    line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, join(current_line_words, " "))))
            current_line_words = [word]
            line_length = length(word)
        else
            push!(current_line_words, word))
            line_length += length(word)
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line_words)
        push!(wrapped_lines, join(current_line_words, " "))))
    end

    return wrapped_lines
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut auctor, est in dictum volutpat, nunc justo dapibus neque."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
formatted_text = join(wrapped_text, "\n\n"))

println(formatted_text)
```
This will output the text wrapped based on the `text_width`.
